item.title: Contact
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
We value your time.

Tell us about your project & build it together.

Get in Touch.

we will answer your questions, scope your project
and discuss your potential fit in style. [contact-form-7 404 "Not Found"]

Join the Community

Bring to the table win-win survival way to ensure proactive domination. Join the Forum

Email Us

Bring to the table win-win survival way to ensure proactive domination. support@themebubble.com

Schedule a Call

Bring to the table win-win survival way to ensure proactive domination. +001-45822475

item.title: Contact
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
We value your time.

Tell us about your project & build it together.

Get in Touch.

we will answer your questions, scope your project
and discuss your potential fit in style. [contact-form-7 404 "Not Found"]

Join the Community

Bring to the table win-win survival way to ensure proactive domination. Join the Forum

Email Us

Bring to the table win-win survival way to ensure proactive domination. support@themebubble.com

Schedule a Call

Bring to the table win-win survival way to ensure proactive domination. +001-45822475

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Welcome to Webify Sites. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Xeckly Concept
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
A digital product for everyone who take charge, make noise, and drop-kick the glass ceiling.

The product team viewed the platform selection process as an opportunity to crystalize how they do performance management and approached the search thoughtfully. âWe evaluated pretty much every performance management tool that exists.â Our role was to create the project from botom to finish.

Challenges and More

As the company approached 50 employees, Stephanie and the Button team made the decision to start looking for a tool. They needed a solution that could grow with the company and make the entire performance review process easier for everyone, not only for the People Operations department. The problem with manual solutions is that they become harder to manage as you add more people, and thus more stress, to the system. âWhen you get to 30 or 40 people, that manual process started to grow from two hours, to three hours, four hours, five hours,â says Stephanie, adding, âIt quickly became unscalable.â  

The Grand Tour

Design and ease-of-use helped Lattice win over the Button team. The team âloved Latticeâs user experience and usability, being able to have split-screens and the ability to customize the transparencyâ says Stephanie, adding, âOur CTO and our VP of Engineering came from Google where they had their own internal performance management system and I think it was something our team was used to having.â
âIt's difficult to deliver a boutique fashion ecommerce site that showcases a compelling brand experience but also converts. Webify delivered just that.â Guthrie Ferguson, Brand Director
We strategized a theme framework that allowed our designers to create beautifully accessible templates, while baking in enough flexibility to allow merchants to customize the experience for their industry. Site Builder extends the administrative experience, separating content into blocks and allowing for a custom but controlled end product.

item.title: Jrink Marketing
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
A digital product for everyone who take charge, make noise, and drop-kick the glass ceiling.

The product team viewed the platform selection process as an opportunity to crystalize how they do performance management and approached the search thoughtfully. âWe evaluated pretty much every performance management tool that exists.â Our role was to create the project from botom to finish.

Challenges and More

As the company approached 50 employees, Stephanie and the Button team made the decision to start looking for a tool. They needed a solution that could grow with the company and make the entire performance review process easier for everyone, not only for the People Operations department. The problem with manual solutions is that they become harder to manage as you add more people, and thus more stress, to the system. âWhen you get to 30 or 40 people, that manual process started to grow from two hours, to three hours, four hours, five hours,â says Stephanie, adding, âIt quickly became unscalable.â  

The Grand Tour

Design and ease-of-use helped Lattice win over the Button team. The team âloved Latticeâs user experience and usability, being able to have split-screens and the ability to customize the transparencyâ says Stephanie, adding, âOur CTO and our VP of Engineering came from Google where they had their own internal performance management system and I think it was something our team was used to having.â
âIt's difficult to deliver a boutique fashion ecommerce site that showcases a compelling brand experience but also converts. Webify delivered just that.â Guthrie Ferguson, Brand Director
We strategized a theme framework that allowed our designers to create beautifully accessible templates, while baking in enough flexibility to allow merchants to customize the experience for their industry. Site Builder extends the administrative experience, separating content into blocks and allowing for a custom but controlled end product.

item.title: Save the World
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
A digital product for everyone who take charge, make noise, and drop-kick the glass ceiling.

The product team viewed the platform selection process as an opportunity to crystalize how they do performance management and approached the search thoughtfully. âWe evaluated pretty much every performance management tool that exists.â Our role was to create the project from botom to finish.

Challenges and More

As the company approached 50 employees, Stephanie and the Button team made the decision to start looking for a tool. They needed a solution that could grow with the company and make the entire performance review process easier for everyone, not only for the People Operations department. The problem with manual solutions is that they become harder to manage as you add more people, and thus more stress, to the system. âWhen you get to 30 or 40 people, that manual process started to grow from two hours, to three hours, four hours, five hours,â says Stephanie, adding, âIt quickly became unscalable.â  

The Grand Tour

Design and ease-of-use helped Lattice win over the Button team. The team âloved Latticeâs user experience and usability, being able to have split-screens and the ability to customize the transparencyâ says Stephanie, adding, âOur CTO and our VP of Engineering came from Google where they had their own internal performance management system and I think it was something our team was used to having.â
âIt's difficult to deliver a boutique fashion ecommerce site that showcases a compelling brand experience but also converts. Webify delivered just that.â Guthrie Ferguson, Brand Director
We strategized a theme framework that allowed our designers to create beautifully accessible templates, while baking in enough flexibility to allow merchants to customize the experience for their industry. Site Builder extends the administrative experience, separating content into blocks and allowing for a custom but controlled end product.

Design and ease-of-use helped Lattice win over the Button team. item.title: Zunco Identity
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
A digital product for everyone who take charge, make noise, and drop-kick the glass ceiling.

The product team viewed the platform selection process as an opportunity to crystalize how they do performance management and approached the search thoughtfully. âWe evaluated pretty much every performance management tool that exists.â Our role was to create the project from botom to finish.

Challenges and More

As the company approached 50 employees, Stephanie and the Button team made the decision to start looking for a tool. They needed a solution that could grow with the company and make the entire performance review process easier for everyone, not only for the People Operations department. The problem with manual solutions is that they become harder to manage as you add more people, and thus more stress, to the system. âWhen you get to 30 or 40 people, that manual process started to grow from two hours, to three hours, four hours, five hours,â says Stephanie, adding, âIt quickly became unscalable.â  

The Grand Tour

Design and ease-of-use helped Lattice win over the Button team. The team âloved Latticeâs user experience and usability, being able to have split-screens and the ability to customize the transparencyâ says Stephanie, adding, âOur CTO and our VP of Engineering came from Google where they had their own internal performance management system and I think it was something our team was used to having.â
âIt's difficult to deliver a boutique fashion ecommerce site that showcases a compelling brand experience but also converts. Webify delivered just that.â Guthrie Ferguson, Brand Director
We strategized a theme framework that allowed our designers to create beautifully accessible templates, while baking in enough flexibility to allow merchants to customize the experience for their industry. Site Builder extends the administrative experience, separating content into blocks and allowing for a custom but controlled end product.

item.title: Spotly Concept
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
A digital product for everyone who take charge, make noise, and drop-kick the glass ceiling.

The product team viewed the platform selection process as an opportunity to crystalize how they do performance management and approached the search thoughtfully. âWe evaluated pretty much every performance management tool that exists.â Our role was to create the project from botom to finish.

Challenges and More

As the company approached 50 employees, Stephanie and the Button team made the decision to start looking for a tool. They needed a solution that could grow with the company and make the entire performance review process easier for everyone, not only for the People Operations department. The problem with manual solutions is that they become harder to manage as you add more people, and thus more stress, to the system. âWhen you get to 30 or 40 people, that manual process started to grow from two hours, to three hours, four hours, five hours,â says Stephanie, adding, âIt quickly became unscalable.â  

The Grand Tour

Design and ease-of-use helped Lattice win over the Button team. The team âloved Latticeâs user experience and usability, being able to have split-screens and the ability to customize the transparencyâ says Stephanie, adding, âOur CTO and our VP of Engineering came from Google where they had their own internal performance management system and I think it was something our team was used to having.â
âIt's difficult to deliver a boutique fashion ecommerce site that showcases a compelling brand experience but also converts. Webify delivered just that.â Guthrie Ferguson, Brand Director
We strategized a theme framework that allowed our designers to create beautifully accessible templates, while baking in enough flexibility to allow merchants to customize the experience for their industry. Site Builder extends the administrative experience, separating content into blocks and allowing for a custom but controlled end product.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
We do it like a pro.

We design digital platforms that elevate the customer experience
for the world's most beloved brands.

Originally from Austria, Christian completed his Masters in Communication Design at University of Applied Sciences in Graz, with a detour to Shanghai, before moving to Porto.

He has collaborated with brands and agencies, providing illustration and visual concepts for a broad range of digital and print projects. Specialising in illustration, mostly black & white, Christian aspires to create artwork that invokes interest with strong contrasts and striving for new approaches.

With a background in skateboarding and a passion for everything outdoors. His work is not about pushing pixels but about telling a story. Christian believes in using his skills for good and enjoys working on projects for a social or ethical cause.Â 

Designer for web, app and everything in between. Christian has been with the company since it's humble beginnings and helped building it as the design part of the team.

Agency that works, yeah.

We've been building brand after brands over the year.
Good branding means good business.

Big brands made.
Built to scale.

  • 02 Build Together
  • 02 Scale Product
  • 03 Marketing
Our mission is to ensure software development teams can do their best work. So we created Clubhouse to provide the most intuitive and enjoyable project management platform teams actually want to use â from project planning to product creation.
